intro: Allodape myrsinites, commonly known as the desert fig wasp, is a solitary wasp species native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is closely associated with the flowering plant Fockea myrsinifolia, which it pollinates through a specialized mutualistic relationship. The wasp's life cycle is entirely dependent on the fig-like flowers of its host plant, which provide both nectar and a site for laying eggs. Its unique ecological role helps maintain the reproductive success of its host plant in arid environments. The species is an important indicator of biodiversity in desert ecosystems.
